nodes.bodyText:
Removing this check because the Add Criteria dialog has input fields which don't have labels. 🤷‍♂️
Minor tweaking for xpath expressions to accommodate new type of UI fields in Add Criteria dialog.
rename selectTab to openTab because I think select word can be confused with menu select.

Cohort build page is not ready until Participants Count is calculated after adding new criterias. Participants Count numbers contain comma character(s). This function waits until Participants Count changes to a digits string with comma(s). It is used to get Counts and to indicate page is ready for next actions.
This seems fragile. Participant counts may not always be over 1000. Could you instead check that the content changes?
good catch. I updated regex to catch numbers less than one thousand. I need to check that calcualated count turns into a number.
Icons don't have labels - why is this called forLabel? What does this method really do?

forLabel function name was chosen for this reason at the beginning, a common static function that finds an element matching a label name. An element can be type of Icon, Select, Textbox, Textarea, etc.
Right, but almost none of those have labels. Could this instead be called findByName?
Are you okay with not changing function name (forLabel to findByName) in this PR? I'll create a new PR to change forLabel function names for all classes right away after merge this PR.
Yeah, go ahead and do that in a separate PR, that's gonna be a big change
Same forLabel question. It seems like this is getting the SelectMenu. Why isn't this function called SelectMenu.get?
nit: participlant -> participant. also, make the plurality consistent between the variable and the function - is it participantResults or participantsResult?
It looks like what this function does is to find and click all items in a list of items - can you change the name of the function to indicate that that is what it does?

user probably doesn't care about there is an internal helper function for finding menuitems. do you recommend a better name? I'd have to rename other select() functions too to keep naming convention standard.

  
    
      workbench/e2e/app/component/select-menu.ts
    
    
         Line 26
      in
      4091a05
    
    
    
    

        
          
           async select(textValue: string, maxAttempts: number = 2): Promise<void> {

Developers are the users here and as a developer I'd prefer to have meaningful function names. I would call this clickMenuItems, and for other types of inputs I would similar functions things like clickRadioButton or clickCheckBox.

Sounds good.
I renamed following three function names (for consistency):

selectAction to clickAction in EllipsisMenu.ts.
select to clickMenuItem in SelectMenu.ts.
select to clickMenuItem in TieredMenu.
